metadata.description: Foundation Words Part 3 - Enhanced with Engagement Features
metadata.pedagogical_focus: High-frequency foundation and action words with full engagement support
metadata.builds_on: Chunks 1-2 foundation patterns, adding action words

words.meaning_support: To discover something that was lost or hidden
words.context_introduction: When you discover something amazing that was hidden or lost. Build this word...
words.completion_sentence: Maya was thrilled to FIND the secret map hidden under the old oak tree!
words.visual_context: üîç To discover something hidden
words.personal_connection_question: What's the most exciting thing you've ever found?
words.story_connection: Characters FIND treasure and clues that lead to great adventures!
words.celebration_message: Awesome! FIND has the 'nd' blend at the end - two consonants working together!

words.meaning_support: To have information about something in your mind
words.context_introduction: When you have learned something and it's stored in your mind. Build this tricky word...
words.completion_sentence: Sam said 'I KNOW exactly where that hidden cave entrance is located!'
words.visual_context: üß† To have information in your mind
words.personal_connection_question: What's something really cool that you know that others might not?
words.story_connection: What characters KNOW helps them solve mysteries!
words.celebration_message: Excellent! KNOW has a silent 'k' at the beginning - you can't hear it but it's there!

words.meaning_support: To use your mind to have ideas and solve problems
words.context_introduction: Using your brain to come up with ideas and figure things out. Build this word...
words.completion_sentence: Maya paused to THINK carefully about which path would lead to the treasure!
words.visual_context: üí≠ Using your brain to have ideas
words.personal_connection_question: When do you do your best thinking - quiet time or while moving around?
words.story_connection: Smart characters THINK their way out of tricky situations!
words.celebration_message: Great job! THINK starts with 'th' - two letters that make one sound!

words.meaning_support: To move in a circle or change direction
words.context_introduction: When you move in a circle or change the direction you're going. Build this word...
words.completion_sentence: The adventurers had to TURN left at the giant mushroom to find the fairy village!
words.visual_context: ‚Ü™Ô∏è To move in a circle or change direction
words.personal_connection_question: When you're exploring, how do you remember which way to turn?
words.story_connection: Characters TURN corners and discover amazing new places!
words.celebration_message: Perfect! TURN has 'ur' where the 'r' controls the vowel sound!

words.meaning_support: Past tense of 'go' - moved to another place
words.context_introduction: What you say when someone moved to a different place in the past. Build this word...
words.completion_sentence: Yesterday, Maya and Sam WENT exploring and discovered three new animal homes!
words.visual_context: üö∂‚Äç‚ôÄÔ∏è Moved to another place in the past
words.personal_connection_question: Where's the most interesting place you went recently?
words.story_connection: WENT tells us about the journeys characters took!
words.celebration_message: Excellent! WENT has the 'nt' blend at the end - letters that work as a team!

words.meaning_support: To not move anymore; to pause what you're doing
words.context_introduction: When you pause what you're doing and don't move for a moment. Build this word...
words.completion_sentence: Maya had to STOP and listen carefully to hear the baby bird's tiny chirps!
words.visual_context: üõë To pause and not move
words.personal_connection_question: When do you like to stop and really notice things around you?
words.story_connection: Characters STOP to make important discoveries!
words.celebration_message: Great! STOP starts with 'st' blend - two consonants working together!

words.meaning_support: Moving very quickly with lots of energy
words.context_introduction: Moving really quickly, like a cheetah running or a rocket flying. Build this word...
words.completion_sentence: The FAST rabbit hopped away before Maya could even blink!
words.visual_context: üí® Moving very quickly
words.personal_connection_question: Do you like going fast or taking your time when you explore?
words.story_connection: Sometimes characters need to move FAST to catch up with adventures!
words.celebration_message: Awesome! FAST ends with 'st' blend - the same sound as in STOP!

words.meaning_support: Moving gently and taking your time
words.context_introduction: Moving gently and carefully, taking time to notice everything around you. Build this word...
words.completion_sentence: Sam moved SLOW and quiet so he wouldn't scare the sleeping fox cubs!
words.visual_context: üêå Moving gently and taking time
words.personal_connection_question: When is it good to go slow and notice details?
words.story_connection: Characters go SLOW when they want to be careful and observant!
words.celebration_message: Perfect! SLOW starts with 'sl' blend and has that 'ow' vowel team!

words.meaning_support: To push off the ground with your feet and fly through the air
words.context_introduction: Pushing off the ground with your legs to fly through the air for a moment. Build this word...
words.completion_sentence: Maya had to JUMP across the babbling brook to reach the flower meadow!
words.visual_context: ü¶ò To push off and fly through the air
words.personal_connection_question: What's the highest or farthest you've ever jumped?
words.story_connection: Brave characters JUMP across rivers and over obstacles!
words.celebration_message: Excellent! JUMP ends with the 'mp' blend - lips together for that 'm' sound!

words.meaning_support: To move through water using your arms and legs
words.context_introduction: Moving through water like a fish, using your arms and legs to glide. Build this word...
words.completion_sentence: Maya learned to SWIM like a dolphin during her ocean adventure!
words.visual_context: üèä‚Äç‚ôÄÔ∏è Moving through water with arms and legs
words.personal_connection_question: Do you like being in water? What's your favorite water activity?
words.story_connection: Characters SWIM to explore underwater worlds and rescue sea friends!
words.celebration_message: Great job! SWIM starts with 'sw' blend - a tricky but fun sound!

words.meaning_support: To move through the air like birds and airplanes
words.context_introduction: Moving through the air like birds, butterflies, and magical creatures. Build this word...
words.completion_sentence: In her dreams, Maya could FLY above the clouds and see the whole world!
words.visual_context: ü¶ã To move through the air
words.personal_connection_question: If you could fly anywhere, where would you go first?
words.story_connection: Magic characters can FLY to reach amazing places!
words.celebration_message: Awesome! FLY starts with 'fl' blend and ends with 'y' acting like a vowel!

words.meaning_support: To put food in your mouth, chew it, and swallow it
words.context_introduction: What you do with delicious food - put it in your mouth and enjoy it. Build this word...
words.completion_sentence: The hungry explorers stopped to EAT wild berries they found on the trail!
words.visual_context: üçé To put food in mouth and enjoy it
words.personal_connection_question: What's your favorite food to eat when you're on an adventure?
words.story_connection: Characters EAT interesting foods they discover on their journeys!
words.celebration_message: Perfect! EAT has the 'ea' vowel team that makes the long 'e' sound!

words.meaning_support: Things you eat to give your body energy and help you grow
words.context_introduction: The delicious things you eat that give your body energy for adventures. Build this word...
words.completion_sentence: Maya packed special FOOD for their all-day nature exploration trip!
words.visual_context: ü•™ Things you eat for energy
words.personal_connection_question: What foods give you the most energy for playing and exploring?
words.story_connection: Adventurers need good FOOD to keep them strong during quests!
words.celebration_message: Excellent! FOOD has the 'oo' vowel team making that long 'oo' sound!

words.meaning_support: To swallow liquids like water, juice, or milk
words.context_introduction: What you do with water, juice, and other liquids to stay healthy. Build this word...
words.completion_sentence: After the long hike, Sam was ready to DRINK the cool, clear mountain water!
words.visual_context: ü•§ To swallow liquids
words.personal_connection_question: What's your favorite thing to drink when you're thirsty?
words.story_connection: Thirsty travelers DRINK from magical springs in fairy tales!
words.celebration_message: Great! DRINK starts with 'dr' blend and ends with 'nk' - lots of blends!

words.meaning_support: To rest with your eyes closed and have dreams
words.context_introduction: What you do at night when you close your eyes, rest, and have dreams. Build this word...
words.completion_sentence: Maya loved to SLEEP under the stars during their camping adventures!
words.visual_context: üò¥ To rest with eyes closed and dream
words.personal_connection_question: Do you ever dream about adventures when you sleep?
words.story_connection: Characters sometimes SLEEP in magical places and have amazing dreams!
words.celebration_message: Perfect! SLEEP has 'sl' blend and 'ee' vowel team working together!

words.meaning_support: To stop sleeping and open your eyes
words.context_introduction: When you stop sleeping, open your eyes, and start a new day. Build this word...
words.completion_sentence: Maya loved to WAKE up early to hear the birds singing their morning songs!
words.visual_context: üëÄ To stop sleeping and open eyes
words.personal_connection_question: What's the first thing you like to do when you wake up?
words.story_connection: Characters WAKE up to discover new adventures waiting!
words.celebration_message: Awesome! WAKE has magic 'e' that makes the 'a' say its name!

words.meaning_support: To move something so you can see inside or go through
words.context_introduction: When you move something like a door or box so you can see what's inside. Build this word...
words.completion_sentence: Sam was excited to OPEN the mysterious wooden chest they found in the cave!
words.visual_context: üö™ To move something to see inside
words.personal_connection_question: What's the most exciting thing you've ever opened?
words.story_connection: Characters OPEN doors to secret rooms and treasure chests!
words.celebration_message: Excellent! OPEN has two syllables: 'o-pen' - you can clap them!

words.meaning_support: To shut something or put it near to something else
words.context_introduction: When you shut something like a door, or when two things are very near each other. Build this word...
words.completion_sentence: Maya had to CLOSE her eyes and count to ten while Sam hid the surprise!
words.visual_context: üö™ To shut something
words.personal_connection_question: When do you like to close your eyes and just listen?
words.story_connection: Characters CLOSE doors to keep secrets safe!
words.celebration_message: Great job! CLOSE has magic 'e' and starts with 'cl' blend!

words.meaning_support: To let someone else have something that belongs to you
words.context_introduction: When you share something special that belongs to you with someone else. Build this word...
words.completion_sentence: Maya wanted to GIVE her friend the beautiful feather she found on the trail!
words.visual_context: üéÅ To share something you have
words.personal_connection_question: What's something special you like to give to friends?
words.story_connection: Kind characters GIVE help and gifts to others in stories!
words.celebration_message: Perfect! GIVE has magic 'e' that changes how 'i' sounds!

words.meaning_support: To have something and not let it go away
words.context_introduction: When you have something special and you want it to stay with you. Build this word...
words.completion_sentence: Sam decided to KEEP the smooth river stone as a reminder of their adventure!
words.visual_context: ü§≤ To have something and not let it go
words.personal_connection_question: What's something special you like to keep with you?
words.story_connection: Characters KEEP magical items that help them on quests!
words.celebration_message: Excellent! KEEP has the 'ee' vowel team making that long 'e' sound!
